text: As suggested, troubleshoot the network setup first.

Then try a HTTP connection using for instance w3m:

text: maybe i'm getting paranoia here, but hopefully this can help you :)
To what URL are you trying to connect?
There could be any number of reasons for this error, most of them having to do with either an incorrect name or IP address or a problem with your link to the remote host.
Have you tested your network connection?
Something on the other end is not responding, due to a severance of connection or a refusal of connection.
Also, post the version of python you're using.
UPDATE:
This is almost certainly a network issue.
I also have an Ubuntu 10.04 machine (32-bit) with Python 2.6.5 that's a nearly pristine install, and I am unable to reproduce the problem.

text: Sounds like chrome and synaptic might be using an HTTP proxy.
In chromium, go to Options/Under the hood/Change Proxy Settings.
Check the gnome proxy settings with:
Do these steps one by one-
This will extend the timeout of your socket.
I was experiencing similar behavior.
Eventually I remembered that I'd run a script earlier that installed a proxy.
Removing the proxy from urllib2 solved my problem.
This doesn't explain your telnet or w3m mysteries, but it may help someone with the urllib2 part.
This page helped me figure out how to remove the proxy.
http://www.decalage.info/en/python/urllib2noproxy
Here's the code:
I think there is some issue with permissions.
I had the same problem on my Ubuntu 11.10.
Calling python with sudo did the trick for me.
Give it a try;

code:
jeffisabelle:~ $ python
Python 2.7.2+ (default, Oct  4 2011, 20:03:08) 
[GCC 4.6.1] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.

>>> import urllib2
>>> response = urllib2.urlopen("http://www.google.com")

  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>

    return _opener.open(url, data, timeout)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/urllib2.py", line 394, in open
    response = self._open(req, data)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/urllib2.py", line 412, in _open
    '_open', req)

    result = func(*args)

    return self.do_open(httplib.HTTPConnection, req)

    raise URLError(err)
